msContents.summary: List of individuals paying the syntaximon.

msItemStruct.note: Pub. status: Recto; Verso contains cols. VI (right half) and VII of SB XVI, 12632

condition.ab: The papyrus is fairly well preserved, but there are numerous lacunae. The surface is broken in places, and the tops of the opening columns have been lost. This sheet contains cols. IX-XIII (left half). One kollesis visible, approximately 7.5 cm from the left edge of papyrus.

handDesc.p: The papyrus is written in a good cursive hand which becomes increasingly smaller toward the end of the document, but which seems to be that of the same scribe throughout. The list has been carefully checked, each entry having at the beginning a short, thick, diagonal stroke obviously added later by a different pen. In addition, some of the entries, especially in col. IX, have a second check placed over the numeral at the end of the line. In view of this fact and the circumstance that three entries have been bracketed (see note to l. 233), we conclude that for some reason the account was doubly audited for this day (the 12th).

origin.origPlace: Philadelphia, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt
origin.persName: Peteus, son of Nekpheros, son of Harouthmeus
Pakous, son of the younger Onnophris
Petesouchos, son of Arkos, son of Pnepheros
Petosiris, son of Petermouthios, son of Kyt()
Panetbys, son of Horion, son of Philon
Ammonis, son of the older Kyr()
Horos, son of Geos the shepherd
Horion, son of Ptolemaios, son of Psois
Archonas, son of Petosiris, son of Hegoumenos
Pnepheros, son of Petosiris, son of Lakon
Harmiysis, son of Pnepheros, son of Lakon
Keras, son of Harphaesis, son of Sambas

provenance.p: Philadelphia, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

div.ab: " Nekpheros, son of Ischyrion, 8 dr. with addition,;Papontos, son of Nekpheros, 4 dr.,;Orsenouphis, son of Amos, 4 dr. with addition,;Panetbyis, son of Hermias, 28 dr.,;Peteus, son of Nekpheros, son of Harouthmeus, 4 dr.,;352;Peros, son of Sambas, 4 dr.,;Nekpheros, son of Pouonis, 4 dr.,;Pakous, son of the younger Onnophris, 4 dr.,;Mysthas, son of Nekpheros Tim.e(), 8 dr.,;Petosiris, son of Panekas, 8 dr.,;Ischyrion, son of Petethas, 44 dr.,;Petesouchos, son of Arkos, son of Pnepheros, 40 dr.,;Hesties, likewise, the younger, 8 dr., ;Hesties, likewise, . . ., 4 dr.,;Hesties, likewise, 24 dr.,;Pnepheros, likewise, son of Ker(), 12 dr. with addition,;Petosiris, son of Petermouthios, son of Kyt(), 8 dr.,;Panetbys, son of Horion, son of Philon, 4 dr. with addition,;Ammonis, likewise, son of the older Kyr(), 28 dr.,;Petermouthis, son of Mysthos, 8 dr. with addition,;208, ;14, Horos, son of Geos the shepherd, 12 dr.,;Horion, son of Ptolemaios, son of Psois, 4 dr.,;Archonas, son of Petosiris, son of Hegoumenos, 4 dr.,;Pakous, Harentotou, 8 dr. with addition,;Esouris, son of Apynchis, 4 dr.,;Herakles alias Lykos, likewise, 8 dr., ;Ptomais, likewise, scribe, 24 dr.,;Papesneus, son of Kephalon, 16 dr.,;Pnepheros, son of Petosiris, son of Lakon, 16 dr.,;Harmiysis, son of Pnepheros, son of Lakon, 4 dr.,;100,;16, Keras, son of Harphaesis, son of Sambas, 44 dr.,;Petesouchos, son of Panetbyis, 44 dr. with addition,;88,;23, Akousilaos, son of Hermoitos, 36 dr.,;36."
